item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 29, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Are PC hardware companies driving technology into restricted closed ecosystems? (83 points | 34 comments)
2. Apple Photos phones home on iOS 18 and macOS 15 (1070 points | 815 comments)
3. I Run LLMs Locally (116 points | 60 comments)
4. Is Iceland getting ready to join the EU? (60 points | 84 comments)
5. WebGL Fluid Simulation (305 points | 39 comments)
6. BioTerrorism Will Save Your Life with the 4 Thieves Vinegar Collective [video] (109 points | 88 comments)
7. Trying to use Bluesky without getting burned again (61 points | 104 comments)
8. Build a working game of Tetris in Conway's Game of Life (2014) (137 points | 14 comments)
9. 20 Years Ago Today, Deadliest Tsunami Set Off Work to Be Ready for Next Big Wave (4 points | 1 comment)
10. Toronto man creates tiny mobile homes to help unhoused people escape the cold (122 points | 94 comments)
11. Intel's $475M error: the silicon behind the Pentium division bug (321 points | 93 comments)
12. Racket-embed-images-in-source-text (36 points | 6 comments)
13. Short-Term Rentals Are Hollowing Out Communities with Loose Restrictions (44 points | 46 comments)
14. Using AZs can eat up your budget – From Prometheus to VictoriaMetrics (55 points | 33 comments)
15. I was wrong about the ethics crisis (180 points | 212 comments)
16. Melbourne Train Control System is running on a hardware emulated PDP11 (61 points | 11 comments)
17. Board game from Mexican prisons brings together people from all walks of life (9 points | 1 comment)
18. 38C3: Illegal Instructions (390 points | 59 comments)
19. Where can you go in Europe by train in 8h? (583 points | 382 comments)
20. We've not been trained for this: life after the Newag DRM disclosure [video] (319 points | 54 comments)
21. I automated my job application process (542 points | 752 comments)
22. Show HN: Kando – A cross-platform pie menu for your desktop (63 points | 22 comments)
23. Breaking NATO Radio Encryption [video] (24 points | discuss)
24. BSD kqueue is a mountain of technical debt (2021) (97 points | 66 comments)
25. Can LLMs accurately recall the Bible? (91 points | 54 comments)
26. EmacsConf 2024 Notes (318 points | 118 comments)
27. Coupling nitrogen-vacancy center spins in diamond to a grape dimer (48 points | 24 comments)
28. The average American spent 2.5 months on their phone in 2024 (115 points | 145 comments)
29. 38C3: Blinkencity, radio controlling street lamps and power plants [video] (175 points | 34 comments)
30. Libsearch: Simple index-free full-text search for JavaScript (67 points | 14 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 29, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
